entry.title: Pelican: A Blogging Engine Written inÂ Python
entry.summary:
There are many static site generators out there. The most well known and famous most likely being, Jekyll and Octopress.

However, both of these are pretty similar blogging enginese. Jekyll is used by Github Pages as the default site generator, while Octopress is a framework geared specifically for blogging. However, the reason why I decided to use Pelican over both of these options doing the job fantastically well, is because Pelican is written in Python, and therefore support the reStructuredText markup by default. I’ve looked into Jekyll and Octopress, as well as many other similar generators, and not many support anything other as Markdown.

One of my primary forcuses of blogging is so that I can also use it as a platform for learning more about programming. I don’t program in ruby so, I wanted to go with an all Python solution.

Enter Pelican

So Pelican became my blogging engine of choice. There are a couple other generators written on top of Python like Hyde <http://ringce.com/hyde> and Nicola <http://getnikola.com>, but it seemed like Pelican was better supported and documented of the batch, so thats what I went with.
